com.tealium.library

Class Tealium

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tealium.library.Tealium

extends Object

    Principle class used for tagging Android applications.

    2014-06-23
    Version:
    4.1

    • Field Detail

      • EVENT

        public static final String EVENT

        Value: "link".

        This is to be used as the first argument in Tealium#track(String, Map, Object), to specify usage event such as button presses.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VIEW

        public static final String VIEW

        Value: "view".

        This is to be used as the first argument in Tealium#track(String, Map, Object), to specify something being viewed such as an Activity or Dialog.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • isActivated

        public static boolean isActivated()
        Returns whether initialize(Config) has been called with acceptable parameters. This value is set in a background thread; thus may return false if immediately called after initialize(Config).
        Returns:
        Whether the Library isActivated.

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(Tealium.Config config)
        Initializer for the Tealium Library. This must be called first, or any other method calls will have no effect. Successful initialization will be seen in LogCat depending on what Tealium.LogLevel was set in the Tealium.Config.
        Parameters:
        Config - a Tealium.Config instance created by Tealium.Config.create(Activity, String, String, String) or Tealium.Config.create(Application, String, String, String)

      • addRemoteCommand

        public static void addRemoteCommand(RemoteCommand remoteCommand)
        Add a RemoteCommand when Tealium has already been initialized. If isActivated() returns false, the given RemoteCommand will not be stored (no effect).
        Parameters:
        remoteCommand - a RemoteCommand instance, if null; this call has no effect.

      • removeRemoteCommand

        public static void removeRemoteCommand(RemoteCommand remoteCommand)
        Remove a RemoteCommand while Tealium has already been initialized. If isActivated() returns false, this operation has no effect.
        Parameters:
        remoteCommand - the RemoteCommand instance to be removed. If this argument is null or wasn't already added; this call will have no effect.

      • getCustomData

        public static Map<String,Object> getCustomData(Object object)
        Get the Map<String, Object> associated with the given object. When any object such as a Activity, View, or Throwable passes through the object parameter of track(Object, Map, String) this Map is consulted for adding data sources to the final dispatch. The object acts as a key for data specific to the event it is used.
        Parameters:
        object - the key upon which to set the data and will be fetched when a tracked event occurs.
        Returns:
        Current Map<String, Object> associated with the given object. A new Map<String, Object> is created if one does not exist yet. Null, if the given object is null.

      • getGlobalCustomData

        public static SharedPreferences getGlobalCustomData()

        Returns the SharedPreferences object associated with Global Data.

        This reference is set upon Tealium.Config.create(Activity, String, String, String) or Tealium.Config.create(Application, String, String, String) as a Context is required to access shared preferences.

        Any data set here will persist across the app lifecycle and all key-value pairs in the preferences will be added to every dispatch.

        Key.UUID can be set before library initialization or found post library initialization (This can be tricky since library initialization is done asynchronously).

        Returns:
        SharedPreferences instance or null if Tealium.Config.create(Activity, String, String, String) or Tealium.Config.create(Application, String, String, String) had not yet been called.

      • onResume

        public static void onResume(Activity activity)
        To be called during all Activities onResume() calls. If the minimum API of this app is 14 (ICE_CREAM_SANDWICH) this call is optional. This method ensures the library to capture accurate system information.
        Parameters:
        activity - that is resuming.

      • onPause

        public static void onPause(Activity activity)
        To be called during all Activities onPause() calls. If the minimum API of this app is 14 (ICE_CREAM_SANDWICH) this call is optional. This method ensures the library to capture accurate system information.
        Parameters:
        activity - that is resuming.

      • track

        public static void track(Object activtyViewOrThrowable,
         Map<String,?> optionalData,
         String eventName)

        Manual track call.

        The parameters in this method are used to assemble a dispatch to fire off to the configured analytics vendors.

        Parameters:
        activtyViewOrThrowable - Any object or null; however, Activity, View, Intent, and Throwables may generate additional data sources. This object is used as a key to fetch data found in getCustomData(Object).
        optionalData - Map<String,?> or null. This data takes precedence over getCustomData(Object) and getGlobalCustomData().
        eventName - preferably EVENT or VIEW, but null is accepted. this will determine the Tealium utag method call syntax. This parameter allows you to associate an Activity with a link event and View with a view event, contrary to the default behavior.

      • enable

        public static void enable()
        Call initialize(Config) with a cached, immutable Tealium.Config object. To be called after disable(); if the library is in an initialized state, this call will have no effect.

      • disable

        public static void disable()
        Shutdown the library. All calls except initialize(Config) and enable() will have no effect. This may be useful when users opt-out or in low-memory conditions.

      • map

        public static Map<String,String> map(String... keyValuePairs)
        Utility method which converts a list of Strings into a Map<String,String> by interpreting the String list as key-value pairs. In the event of an empty-set or odd number of keys, an empty Map<String,String> is returned (so as to be fault resistant). This will report an error level LogCat message depending on Tealium.Config configuration. Usage: Tealium.map("key0", "value0", "key1", "value1");
        Parameters:
        keyValuePairs - strings inserted into the map as key, value, key, value...
        Returns:
        the constructed map if successful, empty map otherwise.
